intro: Fagraea berteroana var. marquisensis, commonly known as the Marquis Island fagraea, is a tropical evergreen shrub or small tree native to the Marquesas Islands. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its dense, dark green foliage and produces small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a woody capsule containing several seeds, and it is often found in humid, shaded forest environments. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
